name: Draconic Professor of War (Fighter 28 / Bard 2 / RDD 10) - with 50 base AB
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Draconic Professor of War 





Fighter / Bard / RDD is quite a famous combo.

This one I aimed to go:

- Fighter heavy pre epic for maximal pre-epic AB
- RDD to pump AB further without going Weapon Master
- Dev Crit, Epic Weapon Focus / Epic Prowess / Epic Weapon Specialisation

Anyway with this build when I worked on optimising this guy I ended up having a starting Int of 16, so I've called him the Professor of War. 

This smarty pants has:

- Base AB 50 - Maximum possible effective AB 82 (+20 AB cap, capped Str, Taunted enemy) 
- Base Str 42 (Str 54 capped)
- Around 500 base hp, +12 AC from Tumble 40 and RDD
- Fire immunity, Paralysis immunity, Three resist energy feats (against Cold, Acid and Electricity) for stackable DR (with items)
- Over 250 skill points for UMD, max Taunt/Discipline/Listen etc from base Int 16->18 (hence the 'professorial' title)
- Lots of useful combat feats (ie Blind Fight, Improved Knockdown, Improved Disarm, Improved Expertise etc)
- EWF/EWS/Dev Crit in the weapon you wish to 'major' in, I chose Greatsword with that Str score

Even though he has weapon foci, he can simply equip any weapon he wishes with Exotic Weapon Proficiency, and still have a Base AB of 47 with Base Str 42. 

He's a brute with any weapon, but a devastating brute with his favored weapon.

Weakness is the saves. He's going to be chugging clarities indefinitely until he gets UMD and can use lesser mind blank scrolls, or has a mind immunity item. Petrify using enemies and devastating critical warriors will need to be approached with care.

Anyway I thought this would be fun to play. A 'Proper' warrior with all the combat feats.


Other notes:
I initially made this guy a Half-Orc to get to Panthro's 44 Str (panthro-the-strongest-dever-in-the-worl ... 54901.html), but he had about 120 odd less skill points so obviously for overall power Human is way better

Dwarf would have also been good too, add 40hp and a whole bunch of dwarven goodies,  minus 43 skill points and a pre-epic feat

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
OK. I did a slightly modified version of this. A gnome with scimitar as greatsword. Mostly for comic relief. (Yes, it's hilarious, Lily as the toon is called barely reaches to the knee of the Ettins and Giants, but can still manage knockdowns due to the ginormous strength.)

Since it's a gnome, I added Epic DR, since DR is king on Blackstone where I play. So far, doing good. A bit of a glass jaw, but if I get a few crits in before they hit me, I'm good. Can't really fight several enemies at once, though. Other than that, very fun build. Thank you!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Great to hear your experience Cornflower. Hilarious gnomish lady knocking down Giants etc, sometimes its best to sacrifice some power just to watch that!

I *suspect* a dex halfling build would potentially be the highest AB melee build, I also think knockdown's discipline check depends on size and AB, so a dex elf build might be the best knockdown build rather than strength. Anyway it might be time for a bit of investigation / experimentation when I get some time.

I've also been game testing this build. Its great right from the beginning, particularly the 18 Str for +4 AB +4 damage (+6 damage two handed). Solo completed the Moathouse in WoG including Lareth at level 4.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Ok everyone

The Academic Professorial Standards Board of the University the dwarven version of the build works at swung by and gave him a long talking to.

His lectures weren't up to scratch, and he needed to write more papers.

Less time in the gym, more reading books. 

Not wanting to lose his Professorial title he put up with their requirements. (Hurumph he thought, not like my muscles are really attracting those ladies anyway. I'll have to rely on my 'natural charm')

Discovered there's a few tricks such as Expertise and Improved Disarm, as well as better ways to knock down enemies (Improved Knockdown). 

Not bad, not bad at all... he thinks...

But there was no way he was going to reduce his diet of roasted goblin shoulders and orc blood beer so he's still kept his constitution up.

(summary: dropped Str to 38, base AB to 47, Int to 16 for +86 skill points, was able to take IK/ID/E he can taunt em now and set some deadly traps, he's become smart and tanky...)

Hi Sinningisfun, welcome to the brethren!

Orion will probably have more to say, but if I may venture a couple of thoughts...

1. What would it replace?

2. Many things will be situational. If you know you'll be facing a lot of acid wielders, then drop cold or electrical resistance for it (sonic damage is seldom resisted, so is pretty much always a good bet to keep), and so on.

Hope this makes sense and doesn't annoy the builder.

Cheers

Hello Sinningisfun & Stag!
I wrote this some time ago, I think I didn't include resist energy: acid (5-) because I was thinking of taking epic energy resistance: acid (10-) but didn't incorporate it into the EDR version. I think you could swap one of the other resist energy feats for it as Stag has suggested, its a good suggestion. 

edit: you won't be able to replace great cleave for resist energy: acid as great cleave is taken as a fighter bonus feat, resist energy can only be taken a general feat

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
In essence, Sinningisfun (kewl avatar, btw), the problem you've got is that every feat that needs to be taken as a general feat rather than a bonus one is taken in that place...except for one. And that's Luck of Heroes at level 1. So you could take the acid resistance there, for a drop of 1 to every saving throw (as you can only take LoH at level 1).

While I'm at it, I must confess, @Orion, that I'm a wee bit befuddled about the reasons behind taking exotic weapon proficiency, but that's probably just me, sorry.

Cheers

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Good idea to drop Luck of Heroes for Resist Energy: Acid
There is a Fort 8+ requirement for Resist Energy. 

For this case I would: 

01: Fighter(1): Great Fortitude, Weapon Focus: Greatsword
02: Fighter(2): Weapon Proficiency Exotic
03: Fighter(3): Resist Energy: Acid
04: Fighter(4): STR+1, Weapon Specialisation: Greatsword, (STR=19)

Exotic is in the build in case a nice exotic weapon drops, with 48-50 AB, you are still hitting them with mundane 45 AB :)
Sometimes exotic weapons can cast spells / day like demonic whips which can cast Flame Weapon
